intro: Inula glabra, commonly known as smooth inula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and produces yellow flowers in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine. Inula glabra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
